findings.information: Found sqlinjection for parameter id (GET) on https://dvwa-login.cs-everbloom-development/vulnerabilities/sqli_blind/

description.title: SQL Injection
description.description: Your application is vulnerable for an SQL injection. This allows an attacker to run SQL code in your database so that he may retrieve, change or delete data from your database.

findings.information: Found sqlinjection for parameter username (GET) on https://dvwa-login.cs-everbloom-development/vulnerabilities/brute/

description.title: SQL Injection
description.description: Your application is vulnerable for an SQL injection. This allows an attacker to run SQL code in your database so that he may retrieve, change or delete data from your database.

findings.information: SSLv3 is offered

description.title: SSL Protocol Version
description.description: A SSL/TLS version offered by the server is outdated. The deprecated versions contain weak implementations that cannot be considered as secure anymore.

findings.information: All certificate trust checks failed: (self signed).

description.title: SSL Trust
description.description: The X.509 certificate issued for this domain cannot be trusted. Clients such as browsers will show warnings or not be able to connect if they cannot trust the certificate. Trust issues arise if the common name in the certificate does not match the webserver domain or if the certificate is self-signed.

findings.information: certificate does not match supplied URI (same w/o SNI)

description.description: The X.509 certificate issued for this domain cannot be trusted. Clients such as browsers will show warnings or not be able to connect if they cannot trust the certificate. Trust issues arise if the common name in the certificate does not match the webserver domain or if the certificate is self-signed.

Trust issues arise if the common name in the certificate does not match the webserver domain or if the certificate is self-signed.

findings.information: Issuer: selfsigned

description.title: SSL Trust
description.description: The X.509 certificate issued for this domain cannot be trusted. Clients such as browsers will show warnings or not be able to connect if they cannot trust the certificate. Trust issues arise if the common name in the certificate does not match the webserver domain or if the certificate is self-signed.

findings.information: TLS_FALLBACK_SCSV (RFC 7507): Downgrade attack prevention NOT supported and vulnerable to POODLE SSL

description.title: TLS_FALLBACK_SCSV
description.description: The TLS Signaling Cipher Suite Value (SCSV) is a protection against TLS/SSL downgrade attacks. The server is vulnerable as it establishes a connection to the client with a weak protocol version even when the TLS_FALLBACK_SCSV value is set in the client request.

findings.information: SWEET32, uses 64 bit block ciphers

description.title: SSL SWEET32
description.description: The server uses short block sizes, which makes it vulnerable to hit the same hash for multiple inputs. By observing the data for a longer period of time, an attacker can recover secure HTTP cookies.

findings.information: Found possible XSS vulnerability on site https://dvwa-login.cs-everbloom-development/vulnerabilities/xss_s/. The parameter 'mtxMessage' seems vulnerable for payload '" onfocus="alert(1);'

description.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
description.description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) allows an attacker to send malicious code to a different user.

findings.information: Found possible XSS vulnerability on site https://dvwa-login.cs-everbloom-development/vulnerabilities/xss_s/. The parameter 'txtName' seems vulnerable for payload '" onfocus="alert(1);'

description.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
description.description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) allows an attacker to send malicious code to a different user.

findings.information: The webserver is running Apache 2.4.7

description.title: Fingerprint Web Server
description.description: The webserver publicly provides information about itself such as the name or version. This opens attackers the possibility to look for exploits specifically targetting the webserver in its exact version.

findings.information: Signature Algorithm: MD5

description.title: SSL Insecure Algorithm
description.description: The used encryption algorithm has severe security issues.

findings.information: No support for HTTP Strict Transport Security

description.title: Missing HSTS
description.description: The webserver does not offer HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). HSTS enforces HTTPS connections, which prevents downgrade attacks to an insecure HTTP connection.

findings.information: No security (or other interesting) headers detected

description.title: Missing Security Headers
description.description: Security headers can effectly prevent certain hacking attempts. You should consider headers like Strict-Transport-Security, Content-Security-Policy, X-Frame-Options or X-XSS-Protection

findings.information: Triple DES Ciphers (Medium)                offered - not too bad

description.title: SSL Cipher Order
description.description: There is no cipher order for HTTPS ciphers set or the cipher order includes an insecure cipher. This means, that an attacker can make use of in insecure SSL/TLS connection.

findings.information: Server does NOT set a cipher order

description.title: SSL Cipher Order
description.description: There is no cipher order for HTTPS ciphers set or the cipher order includes an insecure cipher. This means, that an attacker can make use of in insecure SSL/TLS connection.

findings.information: Server keys 1024 bits

description.title: TLS Key Size
description.description: The security of a TLS connection heavily depends on the used keysize. The server offers a keysize which will result in a weak encryption.

findings.information: Weak 128 Bit ciphers (SEED, IDEA, RC[2,4]) offered - bad

description.title: SSL Cipher Order
description.description: There is no cipher order for HTTPS ciphers set or the cipher order includes an insecure cipher. This means, that an attacker can make use of in insecure SSL/TLS connection.

findings.information: RC4: VULNERABLE, Detected ciphers: ECDHE-RSA-RC4-SHA RC4-SHA RC4-MD5

description.title: SSL RC4
description.description: The server supports RC4 (Rivest Cipher 4), which is a cipher stream that is considered insecure due to multiple known vulnerabilities.

findings.information: common prime 'RFC2409/Oakley Group 2' detected

description.title: SSL LOGJAM Common Primes
description.description: The server is vulnerable for LOGJAM, a security vulnerability against a Diffie-Hellman key exchange using 512 to 1024 bit keys. The algorithm uses in most cases the same pregenerated prime numbers which makes it way easier (and cheaper) to crack such an encryption.

findings.information: Found possible CSRF vulnerability on site https://dvwa-login.cs-everbloom-development/setup.php. The 1. form on the page could be replayed in a new security context.

description.title: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
description.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) allows an attacker to carry out actions in a different security context such as another, logged in user.

findings.information: POODLE, SSL: VULNERABLE, uses SSLv3+CBC

description.title: SSL POODLE
description.description: The server is vulnerable for POODLE (Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption) attacks. With the Man-In-The-Middle attack using the SSL 3.0 Fallback, an attacker can expose data of encrypted connections.

findings.information: BEAST: CBC ciphers for SSL3:  ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA DHE-RSA-CAMELLIA256-SHA AES256-SHA CAMELLIA256-SHA ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA DHE-RSA-SEED-SHA DHE-RSA-CAMELLIA128-SHA AES128-SHA SEED-SHA CAMELLIA128-SHA ECDHE-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA EDH-RSA-DES-CBC3-SHA DES-CBC3-SHA

description.title: SSL Cipher Block Chaining SSL3
description.description: The webserver is configured to allow connections encrypted with SSL V3 in Cipher Block Chaining Mode (CBC). Connections using this settings contain predictable information that allow an attacker to break the encryption using the BEAST attack.

findings.information: DNS Certification Authority Authorization (CAA) Resource Record / RFC6844 : not offered

description.title: Missing SSL CAA record
description.description: The domains DNS zone does not specify any Certification Authority Authorization (CAA) record. This means that all certificate authorities (CAs) are allowed to issue certificates for this domain. To decrease the risk of rogue certificates, append the CAA settings to the DNS records.
